title: Madagascar national rugby union team
text:
The Madagascar national rugby union team represents <a href="Madagascar">Madagascar</a> in the sport of <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>. Although rugby is popular in Madagascar, the country has not yet qualified for a <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup">Rugby World Cup</a>. It does compete annually in the <a href="Africa%20Cup">Africa Cup</a>, and was runner-up to <a href="Uganda%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uganda</a> in 2007. The national team's nickname is the <a href="Malagasy%20language">Malagasy</a> name for the <a href="ring-tailed%20lemur">ring-tailed lemur</a>.
Madagascar defeated 57 - 54 in extra-time to win Group 1B final match at the <a href="2012%20Africa%20Cup">2012 Africa Cup</a>; they have now jumped up 14 places to their current 42nd rank.
History.
Madagascar played their first ever international rugby match in 1970, where they met <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a>, losing 9 points to 17. The second of the series of two games was also won by Italy, 6 points to 9. The team got their first international win during 1987 when they defeated <a href="Kenya%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Kenya</a> 22 to 16.
During 2001 Madagascar competed for the first time in the <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20-%20Africa%20qualification">Africa qualification tournaments</a> for the <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2003 Rugby World Cup</a> to be held in Australia. They started off in Pool B of Round 1, where they contested matches against <a href="Botswana%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Botswana</a> and <a href="Swaziland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Swaziland</a>. They won both their games and finished at the top of the pool to advance to the next round. In Round 2 they defeated Kenya and <a href="Cameroon%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Cameroon</a> to secure the top finish and advance to Round 3, which took place in 2002. Madagascar made their exit in Round 3, losing to <a href="Namibia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Namibia</a> and <a href="Zimbabwe%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Zimbabwe</a>.
Madagascar attempted to qualify for the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a> in France. They started off in Pool 2 of Round 1b of the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20-%20Africa%20qualification">qualifying tournament</a>, where they were grouped with Kenya and <a href="Uganda%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uganda</a>. After drawing with Kenya, they lost to Uganda and finished third in the standings. They were semi-finalists at the <a href="2006%20Africa%20Cup">2006 Africa Cup</a>, and losing finalists in 2005 and 2007.
Madagascar also failed to qualify for the <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2011 Rugby World Cup</a>. It is currently involved in the 2015 Rugby World Cup qualifyings. Madagascar was the surprise winner of the <a href="2012%20Africa%20Cup">2012 Africa Cup</a>, defeating Namibia 57–54 in an historical final. In 2013 the Makis avoided relegation from the top flight of African rugby and remain in Division 1A of the <a href="Africa%20Cup">Africa Cup</a> for 2014, which will serve as the African qualification for the <a href="2015%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2015 Rugby World Cup</a>.
Madagascar wins serendib cup 2013 in Sri Lanka, beating Sri Lanka on a score of 17-12 and dominating Poland on 25–21 score, José Rakoto won the player of the tournament.
